data.title: Advisory Board – CyberUSA
data.text:
David Powell is the Chief Executive Officer for the Federal Business Council (FBC). David is the co-founder of CyberUSA. He and his team have developed many cyber initiatives, including The CyberMaryland Advisory Board & Conference, The CyberTexas Conference, The National Cyber Map, The National Cyber Security Hall of Fame and the original Federal Information Assurance Conference. He is currently spearheading multiple initiatives geared to defining and advancing cyber throughout the country. FBC also works extensively within the Intelligence Community, Department of Defense and Civilian Agencies of the United States Government to produce mission-specific training events, exercises, meetings, industry outreach programs, conferences and expositions.

David currently serves as a Board Member or Advisor for:

The US Army Cavalry and Armor Association (Fort Benning, GA)

The CyberMaryland Advisory Board (Baltimore, MD)

CyberUSA Advisory Board (Washington, DC)

Cyber Resilience Institute (Colorado Springs, CO)

Cyber Threat Intelligence Network (Sedona, AZ)

Commission on the Future (Columbia, MD)

Howard County General Hospital, a member of Johns Hopkins Medicine.

Joe Sanchez is the Executive Director of the CyberTexas Foundation. He is an executive experienced in military and community activities involving Intelligence, Cyber Operations and Security, Education and Legislative matters.

A 6th generation Texan, Joe Sanchez is an executive experienced in military and community activities involving Intelligence, Information Technology Operations and Security, Education, Innovation and Legislative matters. A local “social entrepreneur and technology evangelist,” Joe established a prominent Cyber Security educational base in San Antonio and has helped promote the growth of local cybersecurity industries and associations. Joe served in the U.S. Senate and U.S. House of Representatives as a Congressional Fellow. He currently is the Chief, Network Operations, 625 AF Operations Center, Joint Base San Antonio - Lackland.

Doug DePeppe has practiced multidisciplinary cyberlaw while serving in cyber operations offices in the US Government, in the US Military, and in private practice since 2004. He holds a Juris Doctor and a Master of Laws degree with a focus on national security law and cyberlaw. He served on the 2009 White House 60 - day Cyberspace Policy Review, as part of the Lawyers Working Group; and, in 2012, he was recognized as a Subject Matter Expert for his contributions to the US Department of Energy publication: Electricity Subsector Cybersecurity Capability Maturity Model. In private practice with eosEdge Legal, a firm he founded, Mr. DePeppe provides Breach Coaching and Cyber Due Diligence advisory to corporate leadership, and public-privacy partnership and information sharing assistance to a cross-sector set of clients. His deep understanding of cyber risk, honed from years of legal support to cyber operations, military and commercial, affords clients cutting edge preparation and response to cyberattack. Mr. DePeppe engages in international consulting to both public and private organizations, has spoken at conferences across five continents, and has published his work in periodicals and journals. He also leads two cyber working groups with affiliation to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), including the ISAO Standards Organization; and he serves as Board President of the Cyber Resilience Institute, and leads its Sports-ISAO Program Office. He presently serves as Principal Investigator for a Community Cyber Marketplace model, the c-Market, under contract to DHS.

David Peed is currently the Vice President Public Sector markets at Bedrocksystems. In this role, Mr. Peed is leading Bedrocksystems in their efforts to be a market leader in Trusted Secure Virtualization. David has worked in many leadership positions across a wide variety of technology companies focused on Public Sector growth.

Former Vice President Public Sector Digital Reality Corporation

Former Vice President general Manager Equinix Government Solutions

Former co-founder and Senior Vice President ITekFed

Former Vice President General Manager Ciena Government solutions

Former Government Advisory Board member Ciena Government Solutions

Former Chair Blackridge Technologies Government Advisory Board

Former Industry Liaison Internet 2 Government Advisory Board

Former member Economic Alliance of Baltimore

David Peed is a graduate of Towson State University, and also holds a master of science from Johns Hopkins University in Information Systems.

Advisory Board Member

Dan Miller, CISO

Amentum

Dan Miller is the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) for PAE, a global leader in providing services and support to the U.S. government, its allied partners and international organizations. As the CISO, Dan provides strategic direction and leads the execution of cybersecurity operations across a global portfolio that delivers $3B in annual revenue supporting the United States federal government, defense, and intelligence agencies. Through prior active-duty service, defense contracting, civil service, and private practice, Dan brings over 20 years of experience supporting the federal government in a variety of cyber practices.

Former Cybersecurity leader for Marine Forces Cyber Command supporting their Cyber Protection Teams.

Former Engineer for the Navy supporting their long-haul communication strategy and execution.

Member of ISACA Virginia Chapter

MS in Information Technology from Carnegie Mellon University

BS in Computer Science from University of Maryland Global Campus

Current certifications include CISSP, CISM, and CEH

Advisory Board Member

Brian Harris, CISO

DraftKings

Brian Harris is the Chief Information Security Officer for DraftKings, an online gaming & technology company headquartered in Boston MA. His expertise spans IT, Application and Physical security and has been working in roles focusing on one or more of these vertices his entire career in both large and small organizations. He has expertise in several of the standard security frameworks such as PSI DSS, ISO27001, SOX, SOC and NIST800 and is always educating himself on the latest threats and technologies. Brian’s drive is to protect the people, data, and systems of his organization and to make security a cultural norm rather than just a check box.

Background:

Director of Global IT - TripAdvisor

G4S Security - VP of Technology

Boston University Metro

North Carolina Wesleyan

Cert - CISSP

Cert - CCSP

Cert - CISM

Advisory Board

Chris Morrison, Chief Information and Technology Officer

GRMC Lending

Chris Morrison is the Chief Information and Technology Officer for GRMC Lending, a growing disruptor in the traditional mortgage space that leverages the latest technology and AI to improve the customer experience with goals of $3 billion across 50 states. Chris Morrison serves as the CIO/CTO for GRMC Lending, a subsidiary of Grand River Bank. Mr. Morrison has worked in various leadership roles in technology and information security over the past 20 years. Specializing in start-ups, M&A, strategic planning, info sec, automation, and service delivery.

Advisory Board

Tarunjeet (TJ) Mann, Chief Information Security Officer

Children’s Mercy Kansas City

TJ Mann is the Chief Information Security Officer for Children’s Mercy Kansas City, a leading independent pediatric health organization with 2 hospitals, 23 satellite locations across Kansas and Missouri, and a newly opened research institute focused on genomic medicine, precision therapeutics, population healthcare, and health care innovation. Founded in 1897, Children’s Mercy Kansas City offers 50+ pediatric specialty areas, highest level of pediatric trauma center and neonatal intensive care unit, and one of the only 10 centers in the nation to be verified as level 1 children’s trauma center by American College of Surgeons. Children’s Mercy Kansas City is ranked among the best children’s hospitals in the country by US News & World Report and honored by the Magnet Recognition Program for excellence in nursing.

Previous Company 2013 – 2017: PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC)

Previous Company 2011 – 2013: Bank of America

Previous Company 2007 – 2011: LexisNexis

College: Master of Science in Computer Science – Wright State University, Ohio

College: Bachelor of Science in Information Technology – Guru Nanak Dev University, India

Cert: CCISO

Cert: CISM

Member, Medigate Customer Advisory Board

Member, Wright State University Computer Science and Engineering Advisory Board

Advisory Board

Brian Harrell, Vice President and Chief Security Officer

AVANGRID

Brian Harrell is the Vice President and Chief Security Officer for AVANGRID, an energy company with assets and operations in 24 states. He is responsible for the company’s physical and cybersecurity, privacy, intelligence, and fire protection units. In addition to his many positions in the public and private section, Brian has spent time during his career in the US Marine Corps.

Assistant Secretary for Infrastructure Protection, at the Department of Homeland Security

Assistant Director for Infrastructure Security at the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency

Hawaii Pacific University, BA, Criminal Justice

Central Michigan University, MA, Education

Penn State University, MA, Homeland Security

Advisory Board

Lonnie Snyder, Chief Technology and Information Officer

Special Olympics 2026 USA Games

Lonnie Snyder is a global Information Technology expert currently holding the role as the Chief Technology and Information Officer for the Special Olympics 2026 USA Games. Mr. Snyder has a 26-year history of working with non-profit organizations leading their IT innovation including the 2022 Special Olympics USA Games where he served as CIO and created a first-ever fan engagement app to deliver real-time results and celebrate athletes. He also spent eight years with Special Olympics International, a global organization with 244 national and state Programs in 195 countries and territories where he led the organization’s Enterprise Systems and Health Technologies teams overseeing a complex network of 20 technology business systems used throughout the world by thousands of people.

Former CIO of the 2022 Special Olympics USA Games

Senior Vice President of Special Olympics

Director of Information Technology, Prosperity Now

PhD, University of East London

MSc Information Security, University of East London

Member, CIO Professional Network

Advisory Board

David Tyburski, Vice President of Information Security and Chief Information Security Officer

Wynn Resorts

David Tyburski is the Vice President of Information Security and Chief Information Security Officer for Wynn Resorts. For the last 13 years, he has been responsible for leading the enterprise strategy for information security, identity/access, governance, and incident management for the Las Vegas based developer and operator of high-end luxury hotels and casinos. His passion for innovation in information security and risk management, delivering bottom-line business contributions, avoiding losses from security incidents, improving customer retention, and reducing corporate liability has enabled Wynn to set the bar for excellence worldwide in cybersecurity service delivery.

Previous Company - Boyd Gaming

Previous Company - Bluko Information Group

Previous Company - AppForge, Inc.

College: Bachelor of Business Administration – Francis Marion University

Member, Multiple Technology and Cyber Leadership Groups

Advisory Board

Sajan Gautam, CISO

Arvest Bank

Sajan Gautam is the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) for Arvest Bank where he is responsible for development and execution of Information Security, Physical Security, and Business Continuity Program. Sajan spent 20+ years in various information security roles. Sajan’s experience includes developing and implementing strategic and tactical information security programs. As such, he led various local and global cross functional projects and teams in execution. He frequently participates in various inter-institution forums to discuss ideas, evaluate emerging practices and tools, and drive advocacy around Cybersecurity. He has an MBA and CISO – Executive Education and numerous professional certifications such as CISSP, CCSP, CISM, and CIPP/IT. He has instructed and lectured at universities on Cybersecurity topics and serves as an advisory board member on a few.

Background:

Citi, SVP, Information Security Strategy Planning and Governance

Ernst & Young, Sr. Consultant, Advisory Services

Advisory Board, University of Arkansas Department of Computer Science and Computer Engineering

CISO Executive Education & Certification Program, Carnegie Mellon University

MBA, University of Houston, C. T. Bauer College of Business

Advisory Board Member

Shaun Boggs, Director, IT and Cybersecurity

Key Capture Energy

Shaun is a cybersecurity executive with over 20 years of experience in IT and cybersecurity. Currently, he is the Head of IT and Cybersecurity at Key Capture Energy where he created and runs both departments. He has worked with a range of companies from small businesses to global enterprises as well as government agencies including the FBI, USAID, and others. He has spent 8 of the last 9 years of his career helping utilities and manufacturing organizations build security programs and secure their operations. He is a member of InfraGard and is a founding member of the U.S. National AI and Cybersecurity ISAO.

Former Manager, Global Security Operations at Momentive

Former Founder and CISO at SERAFEND

Former Principal Security Consultant & Engagement Lead at Revolutionary Security

Former Senior Manager, Information Security Engineering & Monitoring at Hyundai Capital America

GIAC Security Leadership Certification (GSLC)

Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)

Advisory Board Member

Miles Dolphin

Miles Dolphin is a seasoned Senior Cyber Executive with over two decades of experience in the financial sector, leveraging his deep understanding of Cyber Security and dedication for innovation to secure highly sophisticated and complex financial institutions. He has held multiple senior executive roles including the Global Head of IAM (Identity and Access Management) and Global Head of Physical Security Technology to protect against the #1 adversarial attacks facing financial institutions today, being identity and physical attack.

Most recently he has led global cross-functional teams of 450+ staff to implement comprehensive controls against evolving cyber threats, reduce customer friction and drive a reduction in OpEx by $17.4 million through tool consolidation, the establishment of centers of excellence, location strategy and driving continual process improvement.

Background

Executive Director - Global Head of IAM and Global Head of Physical Security Technology, Barclays

Director, Global Head of Identity and Access Management, Barclays

Vice President – Global Head for IAM Privilege Access, Data Services and Violation Management, Barclays

Vice President - Global Head for IAM Data Services, Integration and Automation, Barclays Investment Bank

Vice President - Global Head of Automation, Regional Head of Infrastructure Engineering, Barclays Investment Bank

Vice President – Enterprise Management – Architecture and Systems Integration, Barclays Investment Bank

Master’s in Technology Management, Stevens Institute of Technology

Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Stevens Institute of Technology

Author, Cyber Security Curriculum, Per Scholas
